intro: Christella friesii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Christella friesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
